topic: The Science Behind Spaced Repetition: Why It Works for Learning
target_audience: students and educators interested in evidence-based learning methods

refs.content: Meta-analysis of 317 experiments showing that spaced practice leads to better long-term retention than massed practice. The optimal spacing interval increases with the desired retention interval.

The forgetting curve demonstrates that information is lost over time when there is no attempt to retain it. However, each subsequent review of the material increases the time before the next forgetting occurs.
QuizBee implements spaced repetition algorithms to automatically schedule quiz reviews at optimal intervals, maximizing long-term retention while minimizing study time.
